page.title: 16SHOPPING IN SHIPSTON
page.content: People were interviewed in Shipston- on-Stour about their{shopping habits. Of those interviewed,82% lived in the town and 96% shopped regularly in Shipston-on-Stour. 86% were shopping for food,61% were visiting a bank or the Post Office,25% were buying books or newspapers,21% were visiting a chemist,21% were buying household goods and 11% were buying gifts. 64% felt that Shipston needed a second supermarket. Stratford-upon-Avon,10 miles(16km) away,was the most popular{alternative {shopping centre}(64%),Banbury,13 miles (20km) away was used by 44%.Other towns used were Leamington Spa, Coventry,Birmingham,Chipping Norton, Evesham,Oxford and Cheltenham.These towns were visited chiefly to buy clothes,food and furniture.
